column5: I'll be returning to Sturgeon Lake again this summer and while the bulk of the trip will be focused on walleye and pike, I wouldn't mind flogging some decent trout water up that way.PMs are fine if folks don't want to risk focusing the entire internet on a specific water.

No native brook trout in that drainage system. There is a small creek at the very south end of the lake that has brook trout but a 6 incher is about all you could expect. Tag alder lined creek that is no more than 2' wide. It is an introduced population. There are some very good stocked brook trout lakes just south of Sturgeon off of highway 599. If you want river fishing with big fish you need to go further north into the Albany drainage and that is a fair way north of Sturgeon Lake.
Sorry to hijack your thread but I'm taking a trip up 599 beyond Pickle Lake and would be interested in trying for some brookies if anyone knows of any streams, rivers or lakes up that way.
Try this website it has alot of info on it. http://www.web2.mnr.gov.on.ca/fish_o...plorer_en.html
